reviewText: I was surprised by this unexpected interpretation of the classic Poe tale. In searching for a filmed version of "Fall of the House of Usher," I found this item and became interested, knowing that it was not a color-splashed version of a dark, frightening story. Even though I appreciated this austere approach to capturing the mood of the story, younger viewers were not as impressed--having as their only reference points the video technologies that saturate movie-making today. For me, this version created an aura of its own and gave me the freedom to respond from my own nightmares and daytime fears.
i had seen this prior to purchase. it is worth having around for the halloween.
